items.preText: Bright sunshine currently as Gayle and Lewis walks out. Mashrafe to bowl the first over. MGHabib-DC: "Shashank , not all BD fans need to stay awake, we're here in DC wish to enjoy the win by Not Sleeping during the day." -- Oh, yes. Of course. 2.22pm Thanks, Akshay. I'm hoping for no rain. Pretty sure all you Bangladesh fans planning on staying up back home to watch all night are hoping for the same. 2.20pm Right then.. Now that the teams and toss are out of the way, off I go. Shashank will be your man for the first innings; I'll run the distance in the chase. Ciao. There has been plenty of rain over the last couple of days, but it's all clear for now. No saying, though, just how long the weather will hold up. Kester Hamilton: "In a Taxi on my way to the stadium, Yes I called in "Sick" at work and I hope WI win so it won't be a waste of sick leave. " Hide well when the camera zooms in on you. Hasan: "I don't understand!!! Why mash elected to ball first in day night match???" Might be because of the rain.. Curtailed matches tend to favour chasing teams. aksh: "Selecting Anamul for the first ODI was mistake but dropping him only after single failure will be another. Once you have given somebody a place in the team, you should at least give him a run of games. " Arif Hossain: "Shakib Al Hasan should be allowed to ball in the first powerplay. He is a striker!" NazmusSakib: "No pun intended,but Anamul isn't worthy of the squad with his present form. Despite conspicuous positive change in Liton's form,he is being deprived of." Imtiaz Ahmad: "The Bangladeshi selectors have continued their legacy of making strange decisions. I dont think Anamul is a good fit for ODIs, while there is an inform batsman like Liton who has scored runs in the test and in the practice match as well." 2.05pm Mashrafe Mortaza has won the toss and Bangladesh are bowling first. High chances of the overcast conditions - it's pretty dark and menacing in the backdrop - having a say in Mashrafe's decision. Let's see how this one pans out. Bangladesh are unchanged after their win. West Indies have been forced into a change with Andre Russell, who played his first ODI in three years, reportedly injured. Taking his place is Keemo Paul. West Indies: 1 Chris Gayle, 2 Evin Lewis, 3 Shai Hope (wk), 4 Jason Mohammed, 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Jason Holder (capt), 7 Rovman Powell, 8 Devendra Bishoo, 9 Keemo Paul, 10 Ashley Nurse, 11 Alzarri Joseph Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Anamul Haque, 3 Sabbir Rahman, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Shakib Al Hasan 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Mosaddek Hossain, 8 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Rubel Hossain, 11 Mustafizur Rahman wcpak: "@AG: Do you see any changes in the team composition?" Anamul Haque didn't have a great return to ODIs. And he came in at the expense of Liton Das, who was their highest scorer in the Test series, so we may have a swap there. That apart, I don't see Bangladesh making any changes. MasumBillah: "Waiting to see how Bangladesh respond while they are in lead in the series first time in West Indies. Wish them a good luck from UK and expect them win the series today." MahneelMusa: "The match starts at midnight here in Bangladesh time but the night will stay young tonight for the crickets fans of Bangladesh. Lets do this!" 1.43pm There are several ways in which a team can react to being thrashed inside five days across two Tests. It can sap your confidence. It can make you question your abilities. If you're Bangladesh, chances are that you sulked for a couple of days reflecting on what has been. But then, you saw what lay ahead: a series in a format that you have been resurgent in. Bangladesh knew they could handle the white ball. Especially in conditions that resembled theirs: slow pitch, turning ball, grip and bounce. And so, they put up a re-energised batting performance, led by two grinding knocks from their two seniormost batsmen. Then, they choked West Indies with slow bowling and cruised to a huge, series-opening win. Who seems the favourite for the rest of the series now? Hello, folks, and a warm welcome to all of you for the second (day-night) ODI between West Indies and Bangladesh at the Providence Stadium in Guyana. I am Akshay Gopalakrishnan, and giving me company tonight will be Shashank Kishore, as we bring to you the ball-by-ball coverage from the second match in this series. So then, now that Bangladesh have salvaged something out of this tour, West Indies, for the first time, will be genuinely challenged. How they respond to the humiliation in the first ODI should make for an interesting plot as we head into this encounter. We still have a few minutes to go for the toss, so why don't you make use of the time and head over to Mohammad Isam's preview to warm yourselves up?
items.text: beauty first up. Slanted across to draw Gayle forward, left him enough to beat the outside edge.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.text: follows it up with a leg-stump half-volley which Gayle flicks all along the ground to the midwicket boundary.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, FOUR runs

items.preText: Tanvir: "For 25 year anniversary, you should do a inside story of cricinfo (not sure if you already have one out there). Really want to know how you follow each game, write the commentary, are you guys huddled in a room looking at a TV or if you are at the ground sometimes - should be a fun video to watch!" -- Sure, it will be fun. Probably give me a chance to be featured on video too. Yay! On a serious note, wonderful suggestion. Will pass this on to those concerned.
items.text: wanted to defend but in the end played inside the line as this zipped through.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.text: floats this full on off, defended.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.text: gets half a stride in and blocks this length ball
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.text: stands tall and punches to cover, didn't have as much room as he would've liked.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.preText: Spin from one end. Mehidy from around the stumps. There's a long-off in place
items.text: tucks this slider to short fine
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: punches to midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: skids back in from wide of the crease, he makes room and cuts to point.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: sweeps and misses. Lobbed off the pad, brief spurt of excitement from the keeper
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: clean strike over cover. Got to the pitch and lofted it. Too full, got punished.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, FOUR runs

items.preText: Rakesh Sampat: "@ Tanvir; And also "Invite" some of the oldest and most loyal "Unpaid" commentators who have turned up for the commentary sessions and contributed by making comments, sparking debates, creating fun time and adding value to the overall experience. Some of us have been following CI for 20+ years and commenting since the page began allowing us to do so." -- For sure.
items.text: lunges forward and smothers this.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: drops this gently towards point and scampers a run
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, 1 run

items.text: slower and fuller on leg stump, defended back
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Lewis, no run

items.text: gets a good stride forward and blocks
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Lewis, no run

items.text: another gentle dab into the off side, towards cover. Quick single.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Lewis, 1 run

items.text: length ball that grips the surface on leg stump, defended carefully
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.text: tight line, solid defence
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run

items.text: fired full and flat, defended.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: rocks back to cut, this stops on him so he ends up getting a thick inside edge back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: can't get any bat on the sweep, rolls to short fine
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: drifts in and spins away sharply to square him up, kept a touch low as well. Safely defended
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: skids one across, outside off, left alone.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: drifts back in and skids on to thud into thigh pad as he looks to work this behind square.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Lewis, no run

items.text: right behind the line of this length ball as defends.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Gayle, no run
